1. Nh3 h6 2. d4 e6 3. Bg5 f6 4. Bf4 e5 5. Na3 a6 6. c3 d5 7. e4 Bxa3 8. Qb3

  • 1. Nh3
    • 1 ... h6 2. d4
      • 2 ... e6 3. Bg5
        • 3 ... f6 4. Bf4
          • 4 ... d6
          • 4 ... Bb4 5. c3 d6
          • 4 ... e5 5. Na3
            • 5 ... Bxa3 6. Qd3!!
            • 5 ... a6 6. c3

                    • 9 ... Nh4 10. Nxb7 Nxg2 11. exd5
            • 5 ... b5 6. d5
        • 3 ... Nf6
        • 3 ... hxg5 4. Ng5 f5
      • 2 ... d5
      • 2 ... e5
    • 1 ... f6

7 ... Bxa3 8. Qb3

The threat is twofold: exd5-Be6-Bxe5 and Qa3 (more precisely Bb5-c6-Qa3 or Bb5-axb5-Qb4-c5-Qb5, because after Qa3-c5-dxc5 black has Qb6-Bxa6-Rxa3). Because the second threat leads to a fast checkmate, black's best choice is to defend the a3-e7 diagonal.
  • 8 ... b5
  • 8 ... c5
  • 8 ... Qe7

8 ... b5 9. exd5

9 ... Be6

10. Bxe5 Qe7

11. Qe6

11 ... Qxe6 12. O-O-O Ne7 13. Nf4 +-
  • 8 ... b5
  • 8 ... c5
  • 8 ... Qe7

9 ... c5 10. Bb5 Kf8

11. exd5

11 ... Be6 12. Bxe5

12 ... c4 13. Nf4

13 ... Qa5 14. Qd1 +-
  • 8 ... b5
  • 8 ... c5
  • 8 ... Qe7

8 ... Qe7 9. exd5

8 ... Qe7 is the last way to defend the a3-e7 diagonal other than 8 ... b5 and c5.

9 ... exf4 10. Qe6

10 ... Qxe6 11. O-O-O

11 ... Ne6 12. Bc4 +-

If black develops the kingside knight then 12. Bc4 stops black's castling, and black is losing because of Rde1 or Rhe1 coming next.

11 ... Be6 12. Bc4

If black plays 11 ... Be6, then 12. Bc4 stops black from developing the knight to e7.

12 ... Nc6 13. Nf4

White threatens d5 or Rde1/Rhe1 but also Nd5.

13 ... O-O-O 14. Bxe6 +-

White threatens both 15. Nd5 and Ne6... and 15. Rde1 or Rhe1.

13 ... Na5

Black also has 13 ... Na5 to undermine the bishop and stop 14. Nd5. White can just take on a6 or play Bxe6.

14. Bxe6

Black can't castle queenside (white has Ne6) or play Ne7 (Rde1/Rhe1 forces black to castle, and then white has Ne6).

14 ... Nc4 15. b3

15 ... Nf2 16. Rhe1 Ne4 17. d5 +-

Again black can't castle queenside (Ne6) or play Ne7 (d6 forces black to castle, and then white has Ne6-cxd6-Rd7 or Ne6-Nxd6-Rd7).

15 ... Ne3 16. Rde1

16 ... Ne7 17. Nd5 +-
